In these therefore and divers other respects, I supposed the example of this our worthy friend and faithfull servant of Christ might be usefull to many: and was in that regard the rather induced to satisfie the desire of those, that so instantly pressed me in it. Which having once concluded on, I knew none fitter to addresse it to, then to your selfe; who had chiefe interest under God in him, G • n. 2.24. 1 Cor. 7.4. by Gods own ordinance, while he lived; and may with fairest title and plea lay best claime to the memory of him now deceased.
